Job Description
  
  

We are now looking for talented industrial design interns to join us in both our Malmö and Stockholm studios starting in February 2025. For the best experience on both sides, and to really get to know each other, we prefer an internship duration of 6 months. This is a great opportunity for you to develop your skills and get to know more about agency life!
  
  

You will get the opportunity to work with multi-disciplinary project teams on a wide variety of design & innovation projects for some of the world's most exciting clients. We believe in creating a culture where you, as an individual, can take responsibility for your work - but we also take care of each other as we navigate ambiguity, tackle challenging problems, and grow as a team.
  
  

One of our core philosophies is that we believe in bringing design and technology together from the very beginning, breaking down boundaries between the physical and the digital, while fusing hardware and software into meaningful products & services.
  
  

What we are looking for
  
  

An inspiring design portfolio; good ideas, ample creativity, solid conceptual thinking
  
Aesthetic sensibility balanced with a thoughtful, user-centered approach to design
  
Curiosity for sustainability, material innovation & manufacturing processes
  
A humble, self-driven and optimistic attitude; willingness and desire to learn
  
Team player, with good verbal & visual communication skills
  
Comfortable use of CAD and render tools to express ideas & tell stories
  
  

We are also very much interested in receiving applications from individuals that bridge disciplines or have unique profiles & skill sets (ID and UX, material innovation, sustainable design, etc.) - let’s talk!
  
  

We work with amazing international brands, local Scandinavian heroes, and a fantastic collection of startups. We also have a passion for creating our own products and have a good track record of successful start-up ventures. We’re a team of warm, welcoming, dedicated professionals that love to build cool stuff. In everything we do, we strive for a world-class result and we believe you share that mindset.
  
  

Join our team
  
  

Please submit your portfolio and short motivation statement. Interviews are happening on a rolling basis. Applications without a portfolio will not be considered. If you have any questions regarding the job posting, please send an email to Aaron Wansch, Director of Industrial Design in the Malmö Studio.
  
  

Our internships are always paid, and we offer support with visa & work permit processes for successful international candidates.
  
  

We’re looking forward to hearing from you!
  
  

About the company
  
  

Above is a Scandinavian innovation agency driving positive change through a seamless fusion of strategy, design, and tech. We work with the world’s boldest companies to create futures that are optimistic, sustainable, and enjoyable. Our team of 150+ specialists work from our studios in Stockholm and Malmö, Sweden and satellites in Shenzhen, China, and San Francisco, US.
  
  

Want to make the world a better, cooler place? Take the next step of your journey with us.

title: UI Designer
description:
*Mojang Studios is best known as the creators of Minecraft, but we're also on a mission* *–* *to build a better world through the power of play.*


*Why play? Well, play is at the heart of everything we do. It's the blocky backbone of our games, the core of our development philosophy, and even the origin of our name. From the relentless experimentation of our endlessly inspiring community to the classrooms where Minecraft has become an essential teaching tool, play is the bedrock of our existence.*


At Mojang, we create games, products and services to inspire creativity. We develop games with a strong community focus and put players first in everything we do. Our games are built for everyone, because we believe in demonstrating equality and not just talking about it.



We are looking for a UI Designer to join us in developing new games. This is a full time-role based in Stockholm with a hybrid remote working model. We collaborate closely within and across disciplines as well as with our partner studios in the UK and Sweden.



 As a UI Designer within Games Expansion you will be responsible for creating high quality UI for a specific project, in collaboration with others, to deliver the best experience for our players. You will work together with a team of designers and artists spread across internal and external teams. You will also collaborate closely with other disciplines including game designers, creative stakeholders and engineers, in a highly iterative process, to ensure our UI is beautiful, approachable, and accessible.



 Our ideal candidate has a strong desire to work closely with other disciplines on the team with the ultimate outcome of creating a fantastic player experience.



**What you will do:**



 Create wireframes, flows and prototypes to communicate and support your designs.


* Create cohesive and accessible experiences that follow patterns and guidelines, and helping/coaching others to do the same.
* Create hi-fidelity UI concepts and mockups for in-game features.
* Prepare and optimize UI assets for implementation, and work with them directly in-engine as applicable.
* Support the UI Engineers with implementation in Unreal Engine.
* Communicate and collaborate with team members from other disciplines, such as game design and user research, to create a cohesive experience.
* Work with others in the UX/UI discipline to create and maintain best practices and review each other's work.
* Design for different platforms such as PC and various consoles for both controller and mouse + keyboard.
* Document your work and make sure it stays up-to-date and is shared within the project.


 **We believe you'll have some of the following skills and experience:**


* Experience working with UI art and design in the games industry.
* Knowledge of how UX/UI design and other design disciplines interact.
* Experience working with tools like Figma, Photoshop, Adobe Suite etc.
* Experience working with motion graphics or animation.
* Experience working with various game engines (Unreal, Unity etc.).
* Experience working closely together with engineers, game designers and other stakeholders.
* Excellent communication skills, both verbally and in written form.

Desire to be part of a creative and highly collaborative team and ability to take feedback and direction.  

* Please enclose Your portfolio in your application as link or attachment.
  

**Mojang Studios**


*Mojang Studios is a Microsoft-owned game developer. The company was founded in Stockholm, Sweden and has offices around the world, including Stockholm, Redmond, Tokyo, London, and Shanghai. We're always working on new and exciting ways to expand the Minecraft universe.*


*Our community is global and incredibly diverse. We keep this in mind when developing anything, as we want people to feel included in Minecraft. And in recruiting, our goal is to make Mojang Studios as diverse as our community.*


*We got started as a tiny indie developer, and part of our culture still reflects that heritage. But we're also proud to belong to Xbox Game Studios, which creates unique opportunities to grow and develop.*


*To help us achieve amazing things, we have built an equally amazing studio space. Situated right on the water by Söder Mälarstrand, it's filled to the brim with all the tools, toys and caffeine required to create world-class entertainment.*


*But in the end, it's the people of Mojang Studios that make this place truly special. When you join, you'll find yourself in the company of incredibly bright, warm, and creative individuals – all united and working toward a single goal. Come help us reach it!*


***Important note on resumes***  

*Please make sure that* ***all*** *the information in your resume is accurate because we will conduct a thorough background check. Any discrepancies will lower your chances of getting to the next interview stage and we'd hate to miss out on an awesome candidate! Double check that any gap years are reflected in your history, and that your education and work experience are completely accurate. Good luck!*

title: Consultancy: Develop guidance note on user journey across adolescent & youth innovation platforms for country
description:
**Job no:** 573947  

**Contract type:** Consultant  

**Duty Station:** Stockholm  

**Level:** Consultancy  

**Location:** Sweden  

**Categories:** Innovation  


UNICEF works in some of the world’s toughest places, to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.



Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.



And we never give up.


**For every child...innovate**



UNICEF has a 70-year history of innovating for children. We believe that new approaches, partnerships and technologies that support realizing children’s rights are critical to improving their lives.



The **Office of Innovation** is a creative, interactive, and agile team in UNICEF. We sit at a unique intersection, where an organization that works on huge global issues meets the start-up thinking, the technology, and the partners that turn this energy into scalable solutions.



UNICEF's Office of Innovation creates opportunities for the world's children by focusing on where new markets can meet their vital needs. We do this by:


Connecting youth communities (or more broadly * - anyone disconnected or under-served) to decision-makers, and to each other, to deliver informed, relevant and sustained programmes that build better, stronger futures for children.

Provoking change for children through an entrepreneurial approach - in a traditionally risk averse field * - to harness rapidly moving innovations and apply them to serve the needs of all children.
* Creating new models of partnership that leverage core business values across the public, private and academic sectors in order to deliver fast, and lasting results for children.
  


**Our team**
  

  

We're an interdisciplinary team around the world tasked with identifying, prototyping, and scaling new technologies and practices. With our partners, we focus on convening and collaborating on new and different solutions, low- and high-tech, by:


* **Looking** at the 2-5 year horizon to evaluate emerging and trending technologies and to see how UNICEF can work with the private sector on doing better business while improving essential services for children.
* **Investing** in early-stage solutions that show great potential to positively impact children in the 2-year future including the Venture Fund that invests in open-source technology solutions from start-ups based in UNICEF’s programme countries.
* **Identifying** proven solutions that can be implemented at national scale in multiple countries – taking the ideas that help thousands in one country, bringing them to dozens of countries across multiple sectors, and impacting the lives of millions of children.”


**How can you make a difference?**



In response to the evolving landscape of adolescent and youth engagement, there is a compelling need for a thorough analysis of how individuals navigate information and services across a range of UNICEF and partner digital and non-digital youth platforms. For instance, various UNICEF country offices host skills development and learning information content, and opportunities and resources on platforms such as UPSHIFT, Passport to Earning (P2E) Internet of Good Things (IoGT), YOMA, Chatbots, Adolescent Kit and FunDoo among others. By integrating design thinking methodologies in country offices, this study aims to investigate how youth prefer to engage with learning to earning, climate, MHH, MHPSS, health topics and access services across various youth platforms. By analyzing the architectural site map of all adolescent and youth focused tools and investigating their interlinkages and synergies, this study aims to reduce duplication, enhance fund efficiency, and consolidate/streamline operations. Additionally, clarifying Monitoring and Evaluation processes among multiple platforms will be a key focus area, ensuring effective measurement and impact assessment across the diverse platforms. The findings from this study will provide valuable insights to optimize user experiences and outcomes across multiple youth platforms, enabling UNICEF and partners at the country level to effectively enhance their youth offering. The countries of focus will be Nigeria, South Africa and Uganda.

  


**Your main responsibilities will be:**



Detailed responsibilities / deliverables.

  




**Phase 1: Planning**

* Preparation Initial Collaboration and Planning

	+ Collaborate with internal UNICEF Country Offices, Regional Offices, HQ programme teams, and partners.

	+ Develop a comprehensive work plan, defining clear objectives, timelines, and deliverables.

	+ Review background documents, previous reports, and existing data on youth innovation platforms.
* Secondary Research and Pre-interviews:

	+ Conduct pre-interviews with Country Offices (CO) and regional office youth leads on youth platforms.

	+ Gather preliminary insights and strategic inputs to shape the country-level analysis and mapping

	+ Mapping of youth innovation digital and non-digital platforms and initiatives for adolescents in three countries (Uganda, South Africa and Nigeria).
**Phase 2: Country-Level Analysis and Mapping**



* Conducting Secondary Research:


* Deep dive into existing data and resources to understand the current landscape of youth innovation platforms in each country.


* Identify both digital and non-digital platforms catering to adolescents.


* Summarize user journey information for each youth platform to facilitate the identification of overlapping trends and data points that can be consolidated and compared across all platforms for comprehensive analysis.


* Country level User Journey Workshops:


* Lead three user design workshops in Nigeria, South Africa, and Iraq.


* Engage with adolescents, platform users, and stakeholders to map out the user journey.
  


**Phase 3: Data Visualization and Insights Sharing**



* Creating Interactive Maps and Infographics:


* Develop interactive maps and infographics to visually represent the interconnected network of youth innovation platforms.


* Ensure the visual tools highlight key findings, platform interactions, and user journey pathways.


* Global Webinar:


* Organize a global webinar to disseminate insights, best practices, and innovative approaches identified during the guidance note development, including sharing back findings with young people, partners involved in secondary research.


* Encourage knowledge sharing and collaborative discussions among stakeholders from different regions.
  


**Phase 4: Final Reporting and Recommendations**



* Drafting Reports and Concept Notes:


* Compile the data and insights gathered into short reports.


* Capture lessons learned and prepare concept notes for future reference and action.


* Submission of Final Guidance Note:


* Summarize key findings, recommendations, and actionable insights in a final guidance note.


* Provide strategic recommendations to shape future youth innovation strategies and initiatives.



**To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have…**


* An advanced university degree (Master’s or higher) in Social Sciences, Humanities, Business, Design or other relevant fields.  

	+ *A first University Degree in a relevant field including Social Sciences, Humanities, International Relations, Economics, Business or other relevant field combined with 2 additional years of professional experience may be accepted in lieu of an Advanced University Degree.*
* A minimum of ***five years*** of relevant professional experience in areas such as innovation, service design, human-centered design, or UX design.
* Experience in leading user research interviews and focus groups (virtual and in-person)
* Experience working on youth focused innovations at country level and background in youth development and participation.
* Experience in developing user manuals and toolkits.
* Experience in working with multiple countries and with multiple stakeholders.
* Developing country work experience and/or familiarity with emergency situations is considered an asset.
* Developing country work experience and/or familiarity with emergency is considered an asset.
* Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian or Spanish) or a local language is an asset.
* Strong written and verbal competency in English is necessary.


**Travel:**


* The consultant is expected to travel to at least 3 countries (Uganda, South Africa and Nigeria), for a stay of 3-4 nights per trip.
* The consultant is responsible for arranging his/her own travel, including visa and travel insurance.

  


**Payment details and further considerations**


* Payment of professional fees will be based on the submission of agreed deliverables. UNICEF reserves the right to withhold payment in case the deliverables submitted are not up to the required standard or in case of delays in submitting the deliverables on the part of the consultant.

  


**How to apply:**

* Interested applicants are required to submit a financial proposal with all-inclusive fee. Please see the financial proposal template.
* Financial proposal must include travel costs (economy class) and daily subsistence allowance, if travel is required as per TOR and any other estimated costs: visa, travel/health insurance
* **Applications without a financial proposal will not be considered. ￼****Consultancy Financial Offer template.docx**

**For more details and information about the deliverables, please consult the ToR:****TOR Consultant to develop guidance note on youth innovation platform.docx**


**For every Child, you demonstrate…**



UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability, and Sustainability (CRITAS).



 To view our competency framework, please visit here.



 UNICEF is here to serve the world’s most disadvantaged children and our global workforce must reflect the diversity of those children. The UNICEF family is committed to include everyone, irrespective of their race/ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, socio-economic background, or any other personal characteristic.



UNICEF offers reasonable accommodation for consultants/individual contractors with disabilities. This may include, for example, accessible software, travel assistance for missions or personal attendants. We encourage you to disclose your disability during your application in case you need reasonable accommodation during the selection process and afterwards in your assignment.



UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination. UNICEF also adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check.

  


**Remarks:**



Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.



Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered “staff members” under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEF’s policies and procedures, and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein (such as leave entitlements and medical insurance coverage). Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.



The selected candidate is solely responsible to ensure that the visa (applicable) and health insurance required to perform the duties of the contract are valid for the entire period of the contract. Selected candidates are subject to confirmation of fully-vaccinated status against SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) with a World Health Organization (WHO)-endorsed vaccine, which must be met prior to taking up the assignment. It does not apply to consultants who will work remotely and are not expected to work on or visit UNICEF premises, programme delivery locations or directly interact with communities UNICEF works with, nor to travel to perform functions for UNICEF for the duration of their consultancy contracts.

  


**Should you have any questions, please contact us at** swe-ooi-recruitments@unicef.org

  



**Advertised:** 22 Jul 2024 W. Europe Daylight Time  

**Deadline:** 04 Aug 2024 W. Europe Daylight Time

title: Scrum master och Testare
description:
Som Scrum Master och testare inom Kriminalvården kommer du tillhöra ett utvecklingsteam som jobbar med nyutveckling och förvaltning av delsystem i KVR. Dessa delsystem stödjer olika processer inom både häkte, anstalt samt frivården. Vår utveckling sker agilt där arbetet utförs i team som har ett tätt samarbete med vår verksamhet och dess kravställare, både i nyutveckling och förvaltning. Teamen består av Scrum master, systemarkitekt, systemutvecklare, testare, kravanalytiker och UX-designer.
  

  

Tjänsten innebär att du kommer att arbeta som Scrum Master och testare i ett team inom sektionen för Applikationsutveckling, samt samarbeta med övriga Scrum Masters och testare inom sektionen. Vi arbetar ständigt med att förbättra våra arbetssätt med målsättningen att arbeta agilt i både planering, utveckling och uppföljning. Vi strävar efter att arbeta nära både verksamhetsexperter och slutanvändare för att skapa lösningar som tillgodoser både reguljära krav samt slutanvändarens behov.  

  



**Kvalifikationer:**
Till rollen som Scrum master och testare söker vi dig som tar initiativ, sätter igång aktiviteter, jobbar mot mål och uppnår resultat. Du tar ansvar för din uppgift och driver dina processer vidare, men har också lätt för att anpassa dig till ändrade omständigheter. Du arbetar bra med andra människor och kan relatera till dem på ett lyhört sätt.
  

  

För oss är det viktigt att du delar Kriminalvårdens grundläggande värderingar om en human människosyn, respekt för individen samt tron på människans vilja och förmåga att utvecklas. Du är även medveten om och har förståelse för hur bakgrund, kultur och grupptillhörighet påverkar dig själv och andra. Vidare förväntas du med ditt förhållningssätt bidra till att alla blir likvärdigt bemötta. Vi lägger stor vikt vid personlig lämplighet.
  

  

Vi söker dig som har:
  

* Akademisk examen inom relevant ämnesområde, såsom systemvetare, högskoleingenjör, civilingenjör eller liknande alternativt annan utbildning i kombination med erfarenhet som Kriminalvården bedömer relevant.
* Erfarenhet av att leda ett utvecklingsteam som Scrum Master
* Flerårig erfarenhet av arbete som testare i ett utvecklingsteam
* Erfarenhet av agilt arbetssätt


  

Det är meriterande om du har:
  

* Goda kunskaper av agila arbetssätt
* Goda kunskaper kring olika typer av tester manuella och automatiserade
* Förmågan att skapa- och förstå vikten av en gynnsam gruppdynamik
* Förmåga att uttrycka sig väl i tal och skrift på svenska.
* Certifiering som Scrum Master
* Utbildning och/eller certifiering inom automatiserad testning
* Erfarenhet av automatisering inom testområdet.
* Förståelse för programmering och kunna läsa kod
* Erfarenhet av testledning
* Erfarenhet av att medvetet, metodiskt och situationsbaserat växlat mellan manuell och automatiserad testning
* Erfarenhet av Microsofts utvecklingsverktyg (t ex Azure Devops)
##### **Erfarenhet:**


Ingen erfarenhet krävs


**Övrigt:**
Vi ställer höga krav på våra medarbetares säkerhets- och sekretessmedvetande. För att arbeta hos oss behöver du genomgå en säkerhetsprövning i enlighet med säkerhetsskyddslagen. Befattningen är placerad i säkerhetsklass och en säkerhetsprövning innefattande en säkerhetsprövningsintervju med registerkontroll kommer att genomföras innan beslut om anställning fattas. Vid säkerhetsprövningen utreds du som person, din bakgrund och dina relationer ur ett säkerhetsperspektiv. Du behöver vara svensk medborgare, men får gärna ha utländsk bakgrund. I samband med din anställningsintervju får du mer information om säkerhetsprövning.
  

Läs mer om säkerhetsprövningen på: https://www.kriminalvarden.se/jobba-hos-oss/rekryteringsprocessen/sakerhetsprovning-vid-rekrytering/
  

  

Kriminalvården strävar efter en jämn könsfördelning och ökad mångfald.
  

  

Provanställning kan komma att tillämpas.
  

  

För att skicka in din ansökan, klicka på ansökningslänken i annonsen. Frågor om hur du ansöker och lägger in ditt CV ställer du direkt till Visma Recruit. Frågor om specifika jobb besvaras av den kontaktperson som anges i annonsen.
  

  

Vi undanber oss vänligen men bestämt direktkontakt med bemannings- och rekryteringsföretag samt försäljare av rekryteringsannonser. Kriminalvården har upphandlade avtal.

title: UX Designer Senior Expert
description:
Techster Solutions befinner i dagsläget sig i en spännande tillväxtfas och söker nu fler kollegor, inledningsvis dig med minst 10+ års erfarenhet och som kan stärka teamet.
  
Du kan förvänta dig en omväxlande miljö, dagarna kan se väldigt olika ut - men en sak är säkert, här får du använda dina kompetenser och sätter själv gränsen för hur mycket du vill utvecklas. Som ett kunskapsbolag är det viktigt för oss att våra specialister delar med sig av sin kompetens och får kollegorna att växa.
  
**Rollbeskrivning:** Vi söker dig som är expert inom området. Utför användarforskningsanalys för att beskriva användarbeteende och kontextualisera motivationer och användarfeedback. Implementerar designaktiviteter och artefakter för produkt- och tjänsteleveranser samt supportärenden som följer system- och varumärkesriktlinjer för att skapa användbara och attraktiva upplevelser. Coachar/mentorerar produktägare, scrum masters och utvecklingsteam i användarcentrerade designmetoder, bygger effektiva team fokuserade på att leverera affärsvärde som respekterar användarnas behov, och hanterar både lokala och globala team. Du deltar aktivt i att definiera framtida användarupplevelses mognadsnivå och UX-styrning för koncernen. Utvecklar agila arbetssätt inom affärskritiska och strategiska områden, interagerar med högsta ledningen och flera TD/BA. Samarbetar med intressenter och ledningsteam i kvalitetskontroll av användarupplevelseområdet. På senior expertnivå erkänns medarbetaren både inom och utanför organisationen som tankeledare inom sitt expertisområde. - Bidragande till utbildning och utveckling av andra inom koncernen - Har en uppdaterad förståelse av marknadstrender och kan utnyttja starka interna och externa nätverk för att ligga steget före - En ambassadör för TD/BA som tillför värde genom att tydligt artikulera fräscha, framtidsfokuserade länkar mellan sitt expertområde och andra delar av branschen.
  
Ansökan Tror du att du är Techster Solutions nästa stjärna? Tveka då inte att skicka in din ansökan redan nu. Urval sker löpande och tillträde sker enligt överenskommelse.
  
Arbetsplats och kulturVi är ett entreprenördrivet IT företag, med både produktkunskap och försäljning (Techster AB) och konsultativa tjänster (Techster Solutions AB). Det innebär att vi är mycket öppna för nya tekniska lösningar, kunskapsutbyte och ständigt lärande. Att ha roligt och samtidigt behålla den familjära andan utan hierarkier är lika viktigt.
  
Vi vill skapa det konsultbolag som du alltid velat jobba för, men kanske inte hittat ännu. Redan idag har vi en blandning av seniora och yngre medarbetare, såväl som män och kvinnor. Det vill vi fortsätta att bygga på. Så välkommen med din ansökan!

title: UI Desginer l King
description:
Can you take our players on a journey? Do you want to build the world's best mobile games? We need UI design talent to help us level up! You'll drive our team forward to deliver unforgettable games that delight players across the world!
  
  

Your role within the Kingdom
  
We are looking for an experienced and passionate UI Designer to join Candy Crush Soda. You will work closely with UI Designers, UX Designers, Producers, Game designers and Developers as part of an established team.
  
Responsibilities
  
Understand game design and UX requirements to build highly intuitive and high quality user interfaces from user flows.
  
Understand and apply visual guidelines.
  
Actively take part in the feedback loop and apply received feedback.
  
Implement final assets and designs in the game engine.
  
  

Skills to create thrills
  
Experience of crafting polished, visually appealing, user friendly, consistent and distinct UI for mobile games or other fun & friendly mobile applications
  
An well-developed sense of composition and colour
  
Proven knowledge of technical constraints, optimization and implementation (experience in Unity or other game engines is useful)
  
Experience in UI design on multiple platforms
  
Have worked with and have good knowledge about UCD methodologies
  
Used to tackling projects from a very early stage, from written brief to final production
  
Good communication and organizational skills
  
Proactive in learning and developing your skills to the next level.
  
A portfolio demonstrating all aspects of your skills is required.
  
Knowledge of and a curiosity about usability and freemium best-practices
  
Experience working in an agile project environment
  
Previous experience of crafting casual and/or mobile games
  
  

Bonus skills
  
Skills in animation and special effect
  
  

About King
  
At King, we’re Making the World Playful. Heard of Candy Crush? We’re the creators behind it. With game studios in Stockholm, Malmö, London, Barcelona and Berlin, and offices in Dublin, San Francisco, New York, Los Angeles, and Malta, we have a 20-year history of delivering some of the world’s most iconic games in the mobile gaming industry and are on a mission to level-up the little moments for our more than 200 million active monthly users. But we aren’t just crushing it with candies, we’re also behind Farm Heroes, Bubble Witch, Pet Rescue and loads of other sweet games. As a leading interactive entertainment company for the mobile world, King is part of Activision Blizzard, which was recently acquired by Microsoft.
  
A Great Saga Needs All Sorts of Heroes
  
King strives to be a place where everyone can be their most authentic self. We recognize that diversity, equity and inclusion is a vital and continuous conversation, and that change only happens when we all come together. It’s our mission to build a diverse and inclusive Kingdom for our people, players, and community.
  
Making the World Playful
  
Making the World Playful is our mission – it’s the thread that connects our people, our players, and our passion for our games. Let’s face it, who doesn’t love a bit of fun?
  
**Kingsters are seriously playful:** creative thinkers who balance art and science to bring moments of magic to millions daily. But our players aren’t the only ones that can level-up. We’re always looking for ways to champion each other and make what’s already great, even better.
  
So, if this feels like a fun way to spend your days, and you share our passion, our values, and our hunger to shape the future, join us in Making the World Playful.
  
Applications need to be in English.
  
Discover King at careers.king.com

title: Senior Software Development Engineer with focus on control systems
description:
At Alfa Laval, we always go that extra mile to overcome the toughest challenges. Our driving force is to accelerate success for our customers, people, and planet And you can only achieve that by having dedicated people with a curious mind. Curiosity is the spark behind great ideas, and great ideas drive progress.
As a member of our team, you thrive in a truly diverse and inclusive workplace based on care and empowerment. You are here to make a difference. Constantly building bridges to the future with sustainable solutions that have an impact on our planet’s most urgent problems. Making the world a better place, every day.
The job
The Automation Development team is looking for Software Development Engineer in the architecture & platforms focus team. With this position you will be responsible for the development of advanced control systems solutions for all Alfa Laval core products. As our new Software Development Engineer, you will develop our control system solutions in an agile environment throughout the whole product lifecycle. That includes:* Creating scalable control system architecture for Alfa Laval’s global needs through cross-site collaboration.
* Contributing to a vibrant workspace where knowledge sharing, delivering as a team and face-to-face interaction are vital components.
* Developing web-based HMI using our design language.
* Collaborating closely with our UX designers to enhance user experiences.
* SW engineering through breakdown of features, task specification, SW development, testing, documentation, source code management, deployment, and issue tracking.
* Working in Sprints as a part of a self-organizing team, contributing to the evolution of our products.


At Alfa Laval, we offer a hybrid work model with the opportunity to work from home when it fits with your tasks. The position is based in Lund, Sweden. Travel is expected to be approximately 25-30 days a year.
What you know  

We are looking for an engineer at bachelor or master level combined with at least 5 years related work experience with following competences and experiences:* University degree (Automation, Robotics, Mechatronics, Computer Science or Software).
* Experience in Software Engineering and Architecture.
* Experience in object-oriented Software Development Models & Methods (OOP, S88, UML).
* Structured Text or other text-based programming like Python, C or C#.
* Experience in PLC and/or embedded real-time programming and HMI design.
* Knowledge of web technologies, including HTML5, JavaScript, and CSS.
* Interest in Agile Methods and Tools (SCRUM, DevOps).
* Fluent in English (spoken and written).
* Knowledge of GIT or other version control systems is a plus.


Who you are
We are seeking a dynamic individual with a knack for creative thinking, adept problem-solving skills, and a talent for troubleshooting. You'll be comfortable navigating diverse environments, embracing cross-cultural and cross-disciplinary collaborations with ease. Your open mind and team-oriented approach will be invaluable assets as you contribute to our dynamic team. A customer-focused mindset and a solid team player spirit, coupled with eagerness to learn and quickly adapt to new conditions, will ensure that you thrive in our fast-paced environment.
Flexibility and adaptability are key in our environment, where compromise is sometimes necessary. Your keen attention to detail ensures that no aspect of a project goes unnoticed, ensuring excellence in every task you undertake. If you're ready to bring your unique blend of skills and attributes to a team that values innovation, collaboration, and attention to detail, we want to hear from you. Join us in making a difference and shaping the future together.  

What’s in it for you?
You’ll become a part of a diversified Automation team with many backgrounds and experiences who all thrive in an everyday where several tasks and projects shall be handled, both planned and ad-hoc. You will participate in project life cycles from cradle to grave. You will participate in the development of exciting and technologically advanced products. The position presents the opportunity to work in a global company, with great career opportunities for technical and professional growth for the right candidate.
For more information, please contact.
Technology Manager, Automation, on +45 2777 8505 Jonas.Pettersson@AlfaLaval.Com
Talent Acquisition Partner, Claus Wiinholt on Claus.Wiinholt@AlfaLaval.Com
Please send your application and resume through the link below no later than 21 of April 2024
We are conducting a continuous review of received applications. We do not accept applications via email, due to General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR).
We care about diversity, inclusion, and equity in our recruitment processes. We also believe behavioural traits can provide important insights into a candidate's fit to a role. To help us achieve this we apply Pymetrics assessments, and upon application you will be invited to play the assessment games.
We look forward to hearing from you soon!
#LI-CW1

title: Produktägare till SaaS-bolag
description:
Är du en engagerad produktägare som känner dig redo att ta dig an ett nytt uppdrag? Vi på Svensk e-identitet söker dig som har ett starkt driv att ta fram och underhålla tjänster som underlättar för dina kollegor i deras vardag och som gör det möjligt för organisationen att växla upp. Har du erfarenhet från annat SaaS-bolag samt ägandeskap över SaaS-tjänster, eller annan roll där du haft en ledande och samordnande roll som kan vara till nytta i den här tjänsten? Då tror vi att du kan vara rätt person för oss då vi är inne på en utvecklingsresa!


Svensk e-identitet hjälper alla typer av organisationer att enkelt och säkert logga in användare till alla typer av system. Vi är navet mellan människa och teknik, kort och gott: Vi ser till att du är du.

### **Din roll**


I denna roll kommer du att ha det övergripande ansvaret för våra interna tjänster, det vill säga de tjänster som tagits fram internt eller externt för att användas av våra kollegor i deras dagliga arbete. Säkra, välanpassade och lättanvända tjänster är A och O för att vardagen ska flyta på smidigt. Det är också nyckeln till att vi som organisation ska kunna växla upp och ta nästa kliv.


I den här rollen har du möjlighet att vara med och ta fram nya applikationer såväl som att förvalta och förbättra befintliga. Du kommer att ha tät kontakt med medarbetarna på våra olika avdelningar för att förstå deras arbetssätt och behov och på så sätt kunna lägga fokus på rätt saker. Du kommer att tillhöra vår nya produktutvecklingsavdelning där du kommer att arbeta tillsammans med en produktutvecklingschef och andra produktägare.


Som produktägare har du en betydande roll när det kommer till att verka för ett bra internt samarbete mellan avdelningarna. Dessutom är du en nyckelperson i att ta fram säkra och lättanvända produkter som underlättar i det dagliga arbetet. Du kommer att ansvara för att säkerställa att våra tjänster ger stöd till de affärsmål som har satts upp, något som du gör genom att ha en central roll i organisationen där du arbetar nära våra stakeholders.


### **Vem är du?**


För att lyckas i rollen som produktägare tror vi att du har en god förståelse för teknik inom SaaS-lösningar. Du har öga för detaljer och kan skilja en nyttig funktion från något vi kan avvara. Du är också tillräckligt tekniskt förankrad för att på egen hand kunna ta fram underlag och acceptanskriterier för framtida utvecklingsarbete. Vidare är det viktigt att du har ett affärsnära tänk och hela tiden ser affärsnyttan i de beslut som tas. Du får saker gjorda och dina kollegor beskriver dig som kommunikativ och relationsbyggande. Besluten du tar bygger på din erfarenhet i kombination med företagets strategi och skapar därmed tillväxt. Du har ett agilt arbetssätt och trivs att ha flera projekt igång samtidigt.


För att lyckas i rollen tror vi att du:

* har erfarenhet av ledande roll/-er inom IT (produktägare, Team Lead eller annat likvärdigt)
* har arbetat i SaaS-bolag
* erfarenhet av arbete med user stories och kravspecifikationer
* har förståelse och ett intresse för teknik
* drivs av att sätta sig in i och lära sig nya saker
* är kommunikativ och relationsbyggande
* talar och skriver obehindrat på svenska och engelska


Meriterande är om du har:

* erfarenhet av testarbete i samband med mjukvaruutveckling, exempelvis testplanering, genomförande av tester och planering av testfall
* intresse för och/eller erfarenhet av UX och/eller UI
* vana av arbete med strategi, OKR och roadmap
* vana från arbete med Jira

### **Svensk e-identitet - vilka är vi?**


Vi är ett stabilt, tryggt och lönsamt IT-företag med 50 anställda. Företaget grundades i Uppsala 2009 och är sedan 2017 en del av Visma-koncernen. Huvudkontoret är beläget i centrala Uppsala och utöver det har vi två mindre kontor i Göteborg och Söderhamn. Du kommer att utgå från antingen Uppsala eller Söderhamn, tjänsteresor förekommer. Vi tillämpar en hybridmodell med goda möjligheter att arbeta hemifrån till stor del om du föredrar det. Vi förutsätter dock att du kan arbeta från kontoret de dagar det förenklar teamets eller organisationens arbete.


Vårt fokus är att hjälpa kunder, stora som små, med säkra och flexibla lösningar för autentisering och signering. Lägg därtill att vi är Sveriges främsta ombud för HSA och SITHS. Under åren har vi utvecklat en heltäckande och teknikoberoende produktportfölj med ett fyrtiotal tjänster som stödjer över femtio miljoner inloggningar varje månad. Vi förädlar och paketerar avancerad teknik till lättanvända tjänster.

### **Ansökan**


Skicka in din ansökan så snart som möjligt men senast den 12 augusti. Vi har löpande rekrytering och hoppas hitta rätt person innan sista ansökningsdatum. Däremot kommer vi inte att behandla ansökningar innan den 5 augusti på grund av semester. Har du frågor om tjänsten? Hör av dig till Therese Hagelin som kommer bli din chef, du når henne på therese.hagelin@visma.com. Vi ser fram emot din ansökan!


  
Avdelning
Software Development
Roll
Product Owner
Platser
Uppsala, Söderhamn
Distansarbete
Hybridarbete
Application deadline
12 augusti 2024
Competencies
Agile

title: E-Commerce, Social media Internship-LIA
description:
Are you ready to dive into the dynamic world of beauty and e-commerce? At BeautyQlick, we're on the lookout for a creative and driven individual to join our team. If you’re passionate about beauty, sustainability, Tech and AI then this internship position is for you.
   

  

 Your role involves evaluating and analyzing all content to continually improve.
   

  

 You are a good communicator and can push through new ideas and projects.
   

  

 As a person, you are a creative and Innovative thinker. Like to see the result of your effort.
   

  

**Results-oriented.**
* Support our partners and E-commerce Manager by assisting with the implementation and optimization of online marketing strategies, including campaigns, and CRM.
* Manage content updates for our website, including page layout, copy and imagery production, and publication in Shopifybut also in our own BQ CMS.
* Assist with onboarding new partners and beauty brands.
* Support performance marketing planning and production.
* Help align e-commerce efforts with content and social media.
* Collaborate with the Marketing team to coordinate and execute brand marketing campaigns, photoshoots, events, and social media initiatives.


**Qualifications**
* Education in Marketing, E-commerce, Social Media, or a related field.
* Have some knowledge in marketing or e-commerce, preferably in a similar role.
* Strong visual enhancement skills for marketing and e-commerce.
* Solid understanding of digital marketing tools and e-commerce platforms.
* Excellent communication and organizational skills.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment.
* Capability to work independently and take initiative.
* Passion for beauty and sustainability and in Tech and AI.


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Experience in a similar role, preferably within B2C e-commerce, fashion, or beauty consumer goods.
* Familiarity with UI & UX best practices and design tools such as Figma.
* Experience with Google Analytics or other measurement tools to optimize customer journeys and sales.


**Who You Are**
* We highly value personal qualities and are seeking someone proactive, solution-oriented, creative, and accustomed to meeting deadlines.
* Great communication skills


**What We Offer**
* The opportunity to be part of a creative and collaborative work environment.
* Opportunities for professional growth and development.
* A chance to work in a company passionate about beauty, tech, e-commerce


 Fluent in Swedish and English writing.
   

  

 We cannot guarantee that there will be employment after the internship but our goal is.
   

  

 Email us if you have any questions regarding this internship
   

  

 Looking forward to hearing from you!
   

  

**For more information or questions please contact us at** 
 maria@beautyqlick.com

title: UX Design Lead
description:
We are looking for a seasoned UX Lead to helm our design initiatives and drive the creation of user-centric products at Epiceros. With a requirement for 5-8 years of UX/UI design experience, the ideal candidate will possess a profound ability to lead design strategies across multidisciplinary teams, including developers. Your role will involve making strategic design decisions, translating complex user journeys into seamless and intuitive interactions, and mentoring a talented team of designers.
 



  





 As our UX Lead, you will be able to elevate your leadership skills, influence product design across the board, and foster a culture of design excellence within a collaborative environment of designers, frontend and backend developers.
 



  





**Who are we?** 




 Epiceros is a leading innovator in the software development sector, specializing in enhancing online interactive entertainment experiences. Revolutionizing the online gaming experience through innovative gamification and technical solutions.
 



  





**Hybrid remote policy** 




 While we cherish the dynamic synergy of our office environment, we also support work-life balance with a flexible remote work policy, allowing for remote work once a week, in addition to 15 days of remote work annually.
 



  





**Your Responsibilities** 



* Lead and mentor the UX/UI design team, fostering a culture of innovation and continuous improvement.
* Create and refine wireframes, prototypes, hi-fi designs, style guides, and user flows, ensuring high usability and design standards across all projects.
* Articulate and defend design decisions within the framework of our design roadmap and principles, such as color theory and visual hierarchy.
* Stay abreast of industry trends and standards, ensuring the team remains at the cutting edge of design methodologies.
* Foster collaboration across product management and technology teams to conceive and execute visionary solutions for product design, visuals, and user experience.
* Oversee the visual design process from concept to delivery, ensuring a cohesive and engaging user experience.
* Provide design support to the marketing department, enhancing digital communication strategies.



  





**What We Look For** 



* Extensive experience in UX/UI design, with a portfolio showcasing expertise in wireframes, prototypes, and user flows.
* Proven track record of leading design projects and teams with online products/services, particularly valuing those within the
 **entertainment** 
**sector** 
 .
* Proficiency in design and prototyping tools such as Figma, Photoshop, etc.
* Knowledge of basic front-end languages (HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript) to understand the realm of possibilities and limitations within web development.
* A creative and problem-solving mindset with a proven ability to drive design innovation.
* Experience in an agile/scrum development environment and an open-mindedness to feedback and continuous improvement.
* While proficiency in German is a plus, it is not a prerequisite for application.



  





**Application Requirements** 




 Please include a portfolio that showcases your design capabilities and emphasizes your leadership in overcoming design challenges, the strategies employed, and the resultant impact on business goals and user satisfaction.
 



  





 If you are a driven UX leader eager to steer a team toward creating unparalleled customer experiences, join us at Epiceros. Apply now to make a significant impact in the evolving landscape of online gaming.
 



  





 The successful candidate will have to pass an extended background check.

title: Consultancy: Develop guidance note on user journey across adolescent & youth innovation platforms for country, Office of Innovation, Stockholm, Sweden, 7 months (Remote) (September 2024 to March 2025)
description:
UNICEF works in some of the world’s toughest places, to reach the world’s most disadvantaged children. To save their lives. To defend their rights. To help them fulfill their potential.
   

  

 Across 190 countries and territories, we work for every child, everywhere, every day, to build a better world for everyone.
   

  

 And we never give up.
   

  

**For every child...innovate**
 UNICEF has a 70-year history of innovating for children. We believe that new approaches, partnerships and technologies that support realizing children’s rights are critical to improving their lives.
   

  

 The
 **Office of Innovation** 
 is a creative, interactive, and agile team in UNICEF. We sit at a unique intersection, where an organization that works on huge global issues meets the start-up thinking, the technology, and the partners that turn this energy into scalable solutions.
   

  

 UNICEF's Office Of Innovation Creates Opportunities For The World's Children By Focusing On Where New Markets Can Meet Their Vital Needs. We Do This By
   

  

* Connecting youth communities (or more broadly -- anyone disconnected or under-served) to decision-makers, and to each other, to deliver informed, relevant and sustained programmes that build better, stronger futures for children.
* Provoking change for children through an entrepreneurial approach -- in a traditionally risk averse field -- to harness rapidly moving innovations and apply them to serve the needs of all children.
* Creating new models of partnership that leverage core business values across the public, private and academic sectors in order to deliver fast, and lasting results for children.


**Our team**
 We're An Interdisciplinary Team Around The World Tasked With Identifying, Prototyping, And Scaling New Technologies And Practices. With Our Partners, We Focus On Convening And Collaborating On New And Different Solutions, Low- And High-tech, By
   

  

* Looking at the 2-5 year horizon to evaluate emerging and trending technologies and to see how UNICEF can work with the private sector on doing better business while improving essential services for children.
* Investing in early-stage solutions that show great potential to positively impact children in the 2-year future including the Venture Fund that invests in open-source technology solutions from start-ups based in UNICEF’s programme countries.
* Identifying proven solutions that can be implemented at national scale in multiple countries – taking the ideas that help thousands in one country, bringing them to dozens of countries across multiple sectors, and impacting the lives of millions of children.”


**How can you make a difference?**
 In response to the evolving landscape of adolescent and youth engagement, there is a compelling need for a thorough analysis of how individuals navigate information and services across a range of UNICEF and partner digital and non-digital youth platforms. For instance, various UNICEF country offices host skills development and learning information content, and opportunities and resources on platforms such as UPSHIFT, Passport to Earning (P2E) Internet of Good Things (IoGT), YOMA, Chatbots, Adolescent Kit and FunDoo among others. By integrating design thinking methodologies in country offices, this study aims to investigate how youth prefer to engage with learning to earning, climate, MHH, MHPSS, health topics and access services across various youth platforms. By analyzing the architectural site map of all adolescent and youth focused tools and investigating their interlinkages and synergies, this study aims to reduce duplication, enhance fund efficiency, and consolidate/streamline operations. Additionally, clarifying Monitoring and Evaluation processes among multiple platforms will be a key focus area, ensuring effective measurement and impact assessment across the diverse platforms. The findings from this study will provide valuable insights to optimize user experiences and outcomes across multiple youth platforms, enabling UNICEF and partners at the country level to effectively enhance their youth offering. The countries of focus will be Nigeria, South Africa and Uganda.
   

  

**Your Main Responsibilities Will Be**
 Detailed responsibilities / deliverables.
   

  

**Phase 1: Planning** 
  

  

* Preparation Initial Collaboration and Planning
+ Collaborate with internal UNICEF Country Offices, Regional Offices, HQ programme teams, and partners.
+ Develop a comprehensive work plan, defining clear objectives, timelines, and deliverables.
+ Review background documents, previous reports, and existing data on youth innovation platforms.

* Secondary Research and Pre-interviews:
+ Conduct pre-interviews with Country Offices (CO) and regional office youth leads on youth platforms.
+ Gather preliminary insights and strategic inputs to shape the country-level analysis and mapping
+ Mapping of youth innovation digital and non-digital platforms and initiatives for adolescents in three countries (Uganda, South Africa and Nigeria).


**Phase 2: Country-Level Analysis and Mapping**
* Conducting Secondary Research:
* Deep dive into existing data and resources to understand the current landscape of youth innovation platforms in each country.
* Identify both digital and non-digital platforms catering to adolescents.
* Summarize user journey information for each youth platform to facilitate the identification of overlapping trends and data points that can be consolidated and compared across all platforms for comprehensive analysis.
* Country level User Journey Workshops:
* Lead three user design workshops in Nigeria, South Africa, and Iraq.
* Engage with adolescents, platform users, and stakeholders to map out the user journey.


**Phase 3: Data Visualization and Insights Sharing**
* Creating Interactive Maps and Infographics:
* Develop interactive maps and infographics to visually represent the interconnected network of youth innovation platforms.
* Ensure the visual tools highlight key findings, platform interactions, and user journey pathways.
* Global Webinar:
* Organize a global webinar to disseminate insights, best practices, and innovative approaches identified during the guidance note development, including sharing back findings with young people, partners involved in secondary research.
* Encourage knowledge sharing and collaborative discussions among stakeholders from different regions.


**Phase 4: Final Reporting and Recommendations**
* Drafting Reports and Concept Notes:
* Compile the data and insights gathered into short reports.
* Capture lessons learned and prepare concept notes for future reference and action.
* Submission of Final Guidance Note:
* Summarize key findings, recommendations, and actionable insights in a final guidance note.
* Provide strategic recommendations to shape future youth innovation strategies and initiatives.


**To qualify as an advocate for every child you will have…**
* An advanced university degree (Master’s or higher) in Social Sciences, Humanities, Business, Design or other relevant fields.
* A first University Degree in a relevant field including Social Sciences, Humanities, International Relations, Economics, Business or other relevant field combined with 2 additional years of professional experience may be accepted in lieu of an Advanced University Degree.
* A minimum of five years of relevant professional experience in areas such as innovation, service design, human-centered design, or UX design.
* Experience in leading user research interviews and focus groups (virtual and in-person)
* Experience working on youth focused innovations at country level and background in youth development and participation.
* Experience in developing user manuals and toolkits.
* Experience in working with multiple countries and with multiple stakeholders.
* Developing country work experience and/or familiarity with emergency situations is considered an asset.
* Developing country work experience and/or familiarity with emergency is considered an asset.
* Fluency in English is required. Knowledge of another official UN language (Arabic, Chinese, French, Russian or Spanish) or a local language is an asset.
* Strong written and verbal competency in English is necessary.


**Travel**
* The consultant is expected to travel to at least 3 countries (Uganda, South Africa and Nigeria), for a stay of 3-4 nights per trip.
* The consultant is responsible for arranging his/her own travel, including visa and travel insurance.


**Payment details and further considerations**
* Payment of professional fees will be based on the submission of agreed deliverables. UNICEF reserves the right to withhold payment in case the deliverables submitted are not up to the required standard or in case of delays in submitting the deliverables on the part of the consultant.


**How To Apply**
* Interested applicants are required to submit a financial proposal with all-inclusive fee. Please see the financial proposal template.
* Financial proposal must include travel costs (economy class) and daily subsistence allowance, if travel is required as per TOR and any other estimated costs: visa, travel/health insurance
* Applications without a financial proposal will not be considered. ￼Consultancy Financial Offer template.docx


**For more details and information about the deliverables, please consult the ToR:TOR Consultant to develop guidance note on youth innovation platform.docx**
**For every Child, you demonstrate…**
 UNICEF's values of Care, Respect, Integrity, Trust, Accountability, and Sustainability (CRITAS).
   

  

 To view our competency framework, please visit  here.
   

  

 UNICEF is here to serve the world’s most disadvantaged children and our global workforce must reflect the diversity of those children. The UNICEF family is committed to include everyone, irrespective of their race/ethnicity, age, disability, gender identity, sexual orientation, religion, nationality, socio-economic background, or any other personal characteristic.
   

  

 UNICEF offers reasonable accommodation for consultants/individual contractors with disabilities. This may include, for example, accessible software, travel assistance for missions or personal attendants. We encourage you to disclose your disability during your application in case you need reasonable accommodation during the selection process and afterwards in your assignment.
   

  

 UNICEF has a zero-tolerance policy on conduct that is incompatible with the aims and objectives of the United Nations and UNICEF, including sexual exploitation and abuse, sexual harassment, abuse of authority and discrimination. UNICEF also adheres to strict child safeguarding principles. All selected candidates will be expected to adhere to these standards and principles and will therefore undergo rigorous reference and background checks. Background checks will include the verification of academic credential(s) and employment history. Selected candidates may be required to provide additional information to conduct a background check.
   

  

**Remarks**
 Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted and advance to the next stage of the selection process.
   

  

 Individuals engaged under a consultancy or individual contract will not be considered “staff members” under the Staff Regulations and Rules of the United Nations and UNICEF’s policies and procedures, and will not be entitled to benefits provided therein (such as leave entitlements and medical insurance coverage). Their conditions of service will be governed by their contract and the General Conditions of Contracts for the Services of Consultants and Individual Contractors. Consultants and individual contractors are responsible for determining their tax liabilities and for the payment of any taxes and/or duties, in accordance with local or other applicable laws.
   

  

 The selected candidate is solely responsible to ensure that the visa (applicable) and health insurance required to perform the duties of the contract are valid for the entire period of the contract. Selected candidates are subject to confirmation of fully-vaccinated status against SARS-CoV-2 (Covid-19) with a World Health Organization (WHO)-endorsed vaccine, which must be met prior to taking up the assignment. It does not apply to consultants who will work remotely and are not expected to work on or visit UNICEF premises, programme delivery locations or directly interact with communities UNICEF works with, nor to travel to perform functions for UNICEF for the duration of their consultancy contracts.
   

  

**Should you have any questions, please contact us at** 
 swe-ooi-recruitments@unicef.org

title: Cartina rekryterar kollegor inom IT Management, UX-design och Tech
description:
***Välkommen till Cartina - din kompass till en framgångsrik karriär som konsult inom IT!***




  





**Vi växer och söker flera kollegor inom IT Management, UX-design och Tech!** 




  





 Tillsammans bygger vi Cartina, och vi söker passionerade individer som vill vara med och forma vår spännande tillväxtresa. Om du, precis som vi, värdesätter en arbetsplats där både medarbetare och kunder står i centrum, då är Cartina rätt plats för dig!
 



  





 Vi hjälper våra kunder att skapa en hållbar morgondag, och det gör vi genom vår kunskap om samspelet mellan människa, teknik och affär. Vi har lyckats med vårt uppdrag när kunderna har förverkligat sina mål!
 



  





 Vi är ett omtänksamt, nyfiket och erfaret gäng med hög kompetens inom IT Management, UX-design och Tech. Vi är lika nyfikna på att få lära oss av dig som vi är mån om att du ska få ta del av våra lärdomar. På detta sätt hjälper vi våra kunder i deras initiativ och utmaningar samtidigt som vi utvecklas som ett fantastiskt team – och på vägen har vi roligt tillsammans!
 



  





 Som konsult på Cartina arbetar du tillsammans med spännande kunder i varierande arbetsmiljöer och uppdrag som ofta sträcker sig över lång tid.
 



  





 Bidra till vår gemensamma resa i en atmosfär präglad av våra värdeord: Nyfikna, Omtänksamma, Tillsammans & Ansvar.
 



  





**Om dig** 




 Vi tror att du har erfarenhet som konsult och har arbetat inom branscher som tex. bank/finans, försäkringsbolag, offentlig sektor på myndigheter eller inom retail. Du behärskar svenska och engelska i tal och skrift och har relevant högskoleutbildning i bagaget.
 



  





 Som person är du affärsdriven och konsultmässig, och du drivs och trivs när du skapar värde för kunden tillsammans med dina kollegor. Du mår som bäst när du har levererat det lilla extra. Du ser det som en självklarhet att vara en del i en gemenskap där du både bidrar och tar del av ökad kunskap och en härlig stämning. Personligt engagemang är något som kommer naturligt och du är nyfiken på dina kollegor och träffar dem gärna när ditt uppdrag och livspusslet tillåter det.
 



  





**Öppna roller som vi rekryterar till:** 



* **Senior UX-designer**
* **Testspecialister – Automation, QA, Testlead**
* **Fullstackutvecklare - Java/JavaScript**
* **.Net utvecklare**
* **IT Managementkonsult**
* **Data scientist**
* **Teknisk Projektledare, Programledare**
* **Lösningsarkitekter**
* **Cloud arkitekt**
* **Informationsarkitekt**



  





**Du kan läsa mer om rollerna på vår
 
 Lediga jobba sida**




  





**Vad vi erbjuder dig** 




 Utöver en stimulerande roll som konsult hos våra kunder kommer du ha stor möjlighet i att påverka och medverka till att leda Cartinas tillväxt och affärsutveckling. Du erbjuds en konkurrenskraftig ersättning och förmåner med bl.a. tjänstepension och rådgivningstjänster, hälsosluss, friskvård, förmånscykel m.m.
 



  





 Vi har valt att verka i en utvecklande och stimulerande miljö med många likasinnade bolag, därför sitter Cartina på Epicenter med över 150 event & föreläsningar inom olika områden per år.
 



  





**Om Cartina** 




 Genom vår kunskap om samspelet mellan människa, teknik och affär gör vi det möjligt för våra kunder att förverkliga sina visioner. Cartina är ett konsultbolag som grundades 2013 och som drivs av lyhörda, omtänksamma och nyfikna experter inom IT Management, Tech och UX Design.
 



 I vårt kundlöfte lyfter vi fram att vi tar ansvar för att leverera det våra kunder behöver, och lite till.
 



 Mer om oss hittar du
 
 här
 
 .
 



  





**Övrig information** 




 Start: Så snart som möjligt med hänsyn till uppsägningstid.
 



  





 Omfattning: Heltid, tillsvidare med inledande provanställning eller enligt överenskommelse
 



  





 Placering: Hybrid, placering hos kund. Cartina sitter på Epicenter, Malmskillnadsgatan 44A.
 



  





**Rekryteringsprocess:** 
 Urval -->HR intervju -->Teknisk intervju --> Chefsintervju -->Kontroller --> Erbjudande & Avtalsskrivning. Vår ambition är att tillsätta rollerna snabbt och att du som sökande löpande får återkoppling under processens gång. Pga sommarledigheter kommer vi börja urvalet när sista ansökningsdagen har passerat.
 



  





 Vi har gått ifrån personligt brev i rekryteringsprocesser till förmån för urvalsfrågor. Som en del av rekryteringsprocessen kommer vi ta referenser och utföra bakgrundskontroller. Vänligen notera att vi inte tar emot några ansökningar via email med hänsyn till GDPR.
 



  





 Varmt välkommen med din ansökan och till Cartina!

title: IT Test Manager
description:
**We are looking for a IT Test Manager for our client in the financial sector. The Test manager has to schedule regular status meetings and get feedback from testers as well as send the status reports. Ensure the product delivered to the customer is of optimum quality. The test manager has to introduce suitable metrics for evaluating test progress and assessing product quality.**


### **Requirements**


* Responsibilities include understanding of business requirements (functional and non-functional), drafting and ownership of Master Test Plan, planning of testing resources, test execution monitoring and publishing test results.
* E2E process coordination and monitoring.
* Ensure setup of necessary environment and tools for different types of testing levels.
* Provide necessary documentation as per the process defined.

title: Data Engineer
description:
**Join us in creating world-class creativity apps used by millions of people.**


Appostrophe is a mobile app development company creating easy-to-use design tools that unlock people's creativity. Our portfolio consists of top-listed apps such as SCRL, Memo, Text Art, and Add Text that are used and loved by millions of people worldwide. We’re a small, ambitious team that enjoys working together in central Stockholm and are looking for more like-minded people to join our mission.


We are looking for a talented Data Engineer to join the analytics team that handles the data and analysis of an app portfolio with millions of monthly users.

 **What you will do**

* Be responsible for our ETL system, guaranteeing its ease of use, reliability, and error reporting capabilities.
* Establish data retrieval processes to collect data from the services we use through API calls.
* Support with creation of internal libraries to help with app metrics calculations.
* Bring to production data scientists’ models so that they can be accessed easily by the team.
* Handle backend topics such as notifications messaging for in-app promotions.
* Shape the development of our technologies aimed at the acquisition, storage, and manipulation of big data and metrics calculation.
* Be a beacon and an evangelist of data culture throughout the company.

 **You should have**

  

* **IT knowledge**. You have excellent knowledge of Python, SQL and NodeJS or other languages used for data engineering.
* **Data pipelines owner.** You know how to fully manage data pipelines from data ingestions to processing in the most efficient way.
* **Interest in our industry.** You have experience or a strong interest in the subscription app business and you want to use your knowledge of data engineering to support Appostrophe in its mission to create the most amazing apps for its customers.
* **Good communication skills.** You are able to communicate insights, strategies, and results clearly and effectively to the team. You can make complex topics you manage easy to understand.
* **Quality and pragmatism.** You are able to work at a high pace without compromising quality.
* **Can-do attitude.** You are a self-motivated problem solver with an eye for details and an internal drive for excellence.

 **We offer**

  

* Opportunity to be creative and test new ideas.
* Important role in a successful startup.
* Great colleagues and office in central Stockholm.
* Competitive salary.

title: IT Architect & Solution Architect
description:

* Crafting and Executing CRM Solutions: Tailoring CRM solutions to meet the needs of the business.
* Cross-Departmental Collaboration: Working with various departments to comprehend their CRM requirements.

* Have been integrating CRM with other systems
* Been working with Design and design documentation

**Meritorious:**

  

* Experience with Microsoft Dynamics or SugarCRM is a plus.

**Utilization****:** 100**%**
